Before long, Jack got carried too far away. He noticed that he couldn't see Jill anymore. He was starting to get scared. 
Suddenly, Jill swam to him and said, "Don't worry! Attach yourself to me and we won't drift away." 
Jack and Jill stayed together, happy and safe while they enjoyed the beach and the waves.
They learnt that the moral of the story was that it is important to stay close together and look out for each other, especially when we are in unfamiliar places.

a big slide in the park. He wanted to play on the slide.
Before Tim went on the slide, he decided to study it. He looked at the slide from top to bottom. He saw that it was very tall and very fast. But Tim was not scared. He wanted to try the slide.
Tim climbed up the slide and sat at the top. He was ready to go down. But when he slid down the slide, he went too fast. Tim fell off the slide and got hurt. He cried, and his mom came to help him. Tim learned that sometimes being adventurous can lead to a bad ending.

Before they left the store, Mommy promised Baby, “If you’re a good boy and obey me, you can have a surprise when we get home.”
Baby was very obedient, as they went all the way home. When they arrived, Mommy said, “You were so obedient! Here’s your surprise!” With a big smile, she held out another toy for Baby - an even bigger, green car. 
Baby was so happy to have two toys! He hugged Mommy, thanked her, and ran off to play.

Before the game, Tom and Jen organize their team. They tell their teammates what to do. Tom is the captain. He says, "We have to work together. We have to pass the ball. We have to score goals." Jen is the goalie. She says, "I will stop the ball. I will catch it. I will throw it to you."
The game starts. Tom and Jen's team plays well. They pass the ball. They score goals. The other team is not happy. They wear gray shirts. They are mean. They push and kick. They cheat.
